articles.description: The new Premier League is about to start - BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty and BBC Sport fan writers predict who will finish where.
articles.title: Premier League predictions: Who will finish where in 2024-25?

articles.description: Are European champions Real Madrid going to be even stronger this term, with the likes of Kylian Mbappe and Endrick joining their ranks?
articles.title: Real Madrid: Are the best in Europe about to get better?

articles.description: Chelsea midfielder Romeo Lavia speaks about his belief that the club are building something special - and how he is ready to be part of it after an injury-troubled year.
articles.title: Romeo Lavia: Chelsea midfielder on dealing with injury setbacks

articles.description: Eduardo Camavinga will miss Real Madrid's Uefa Super Cup match against Atalanta - and the start of the season - with a knee injury suffered in training.
articles.title: Eduardo Camavinga: Real Madrid midfielder out of Super Cup with knee injury

articles.description: Former world number one Naomi Osaka says she does not "feel like I'm in my body" following her return to tennis after a maternity break.
articles.title: Naomi Osaka: Former world number one does not feel like herself after maternity break

articles.description: With flag football preparing to join the next Olympics in Los Angeles, is the NFL set to field its own Dream Team in 2028?
articles.title: LA 2028 flag football: Could there be an NFL Dream Team at the next Olympics?

articles.description: The Paris public prosecutor's office says it has launched a cyberbullying probe.
articles.title: JK Rowling and Elon Musk reportedly named in Imane Khelif lawsuit

articles.description: Rangers count the cost of missing out on an extended Champions League run with initial Europa League earnings equivalent to a quarter.
articles.title: What does Rangers' Champions League exit mean for finances?

articles.description: Jose Mourinho said he "can't speak" about refereeing decisions he felt led to Fenerbahce's exit from the Champions League.
articles.title: Jose Mourinho repeats 'can't speak' line after Fenerbahce Champions League exit

articles.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says she "really likes" the pressure of succeeding former boss Emma Hayes and "wants to build from her legacy".
articles.title: Chelsea: Manager Sonia Bompastor 'really likes pressure' of succeeding Emma Hayes
